comments_since_last_sample.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

One of the founders of the Lincoln Project also foisted Sarah Palin on to the national stage - a direct line can be drawn from that moment to Trump's election. He also makes a shitload of $$$ by playing in politics on all sides.

They’re republicans. No one ever said they were smart.

Edit: Wait. Is that a black white supremacist?

The McAuliffe campaign was in on it.

At least 2 of those 5 people were Virginia Democrats' staffers. Democrats then started tweeting about this in unison,pretending they were actually Youngkin supporters.

Not the 1st time Democrats were caught doing it. In 2016 a Clinton super PAC was caught on video bragging about sending agitators to Trump rallies. 1 of those rallies (in Chicago) had to be cancelled due to leftist violence.

He also bragged that the old lady with an oxygen tank who claimed to have been attacked by a Trump supporter,was working for them.

Obviously,the objective,totally unbiased truth tellers in the media blamed Trump for it.

And as usual headline writers pick less accurate and more inflammatory ways to phrase it. 

You can pose for a photo, or you can pose as an attempt to actually pass for something you aren’t. It seems impossible that this was really the latter which is what the headline makes it sound like. They were dressed as the unite the right participants as part of a demonstration, not pretending to be white supremacists in a false flag style act.

Btw I find this stunt in poor taste regardless
Dumb republicans trolling even dumber republicans. Congrats all round on dragging politics even further down into a fucking clown show.
Maybe I should care about Republicans attacking each other, but I don't.
Probably the dumbest political stunt I've ever seen. Good job.
